pixi.extras.MovieClip

type
class
extends
pixi.core.sprites.Sprite
metadata
:native
"PIXI.extras.MovieClip"

Static Methods

fromFrames(frames : Array<String>) : MovieClip

parameters
frames {Array} the array of frames ids the movieclip will use as its texture frames
A short hand way of creating a movieclip from an array of frame ids

fromImages(images : Array<String>) : MovieClip

parameters
images {Array} the array of image urls the movieclip will use as its texture frames
A short hand way of creating a movieclip from an array of image ids

Constructor

new(textures : Array<pixi.core.textures.Texture>)
parameters
textures {Texture[]} an array of {Texture} objects that make up the animation
A MovieClip is a simple way to display an animation depicted by a list of textures. ```js var alienImages = "image_sequence_01.png","image_sequence_02.png","image_sequence_03.png","image_sequence_04.png"; var textureArray = ; for ( var i=0; i < 4; i++) { var texture = PIXI.Texture.fromImage(alienImagesi); textureArray.push(texture); }; var mc = new PIXI.MovieClip(textureArray); ```

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

alpha : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The opacity of the object.

anchor : pixi.core.math.Point

inherited from pixi.core.sprites.Sprite
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture. The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

animationSpeed : Float

The speed that the MovieClip will play at. Higher is faster, lower is slower

autoPreventDefault : Bool

inherited from pixi.interaction.InteractionManager
Should default browser actions automatically be prevented.

blendMode : Int

inherited from pixi.core.sprites.Sprite
The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to CONST.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

buttonMode : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Indicates if the displayObject uses button mode or normal mode.

cacheAsBitmap : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Set this to true if you want this display object to be cached as a bitmap. This basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects. To remove simply set this property to 'null'

filterArea : pixi.core.math.shapes.Rectangle

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The area the filter is applied to. This is used as more of an optimisation rather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

filters : Array<Dynamic>

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Sets the filters for the displayObject. * IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer. To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

inherited from pixi.core.display.Container

last : Int

inherited from pixi.interaction.InteractionManager

loop : Bool

Whether or not the movie clip repeats after playing.

mask : Dynamic

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it. In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping. To remove a mask, set this property to null.

tint : Int

inherited from pixi.core.sprites.Sprite
The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

totalFrames : Int

totalFrames is the total number of frames in the MovieClip. This is the same as number of textures assigned to the MovieClip.

visible : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The visibility of the object. If false the object will not be drawn, and the updateTransform function will not be called.

inherited from pixi.core.display.Container

generateTexture(renderer : pixi.core.renderers.webgl.WebGLRenderer, ?resolution : Float, ?scaleMode : Int) : pixi.core.textures.Texture

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
parameters
renderer {CanvasRenderer|WebGLRenderer} The renderer used to generate the texture.
resolution {Number} The resolution of the texture being generated
scaleMode {Number} See {@link SCALE_MODES} for possible values
returns
{Texture} a texture of the display object
Useful function that returns a texture of the display object that can then be used to create sprites This can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.

mapPositionToPoint(point : pixi.core.math.Point, x : Float, y : Float) : Void

inherited from pixi.interaction.InteractionManager
parameters
{Point} point the point that the result will be stored in
{Float} x the x coord of the position to map
{Float} y the y coord of the position to map
Maps x and y coords from a DOM object and maps them correctly to the pixi view. The resulting value is stored in the point. This takes into account the fact that the DOM element could be scaled and positioned anywhere on the screen.

play() : Void

Plays the MovieClip

processInteractive(point : pixi.core.math.Point, displayObject : pixi.core.display.DisplayObject, func : Void -> Void, hitTest : Bool, interactive : Bool) : Bool

inherited from pixi.interaction.InteractionManager
parameters
{Point} point the point that is tested for collision
{Container|Sprite|TilingSprite} displayObject the displayObject that will be hit test (recurcsivly crawls its children)
{function} func the function that will be called on each interactive object. The displayObject and hit will be passed to the function
{Bool} hitTest this indicates if the objects inside should be hit test against the point
returns
{Bool} returns true if the displayObject hit the point
This function is provides a neat way of crawling through the scene graph and running a specified function on all interactive objects it finds. It will also take care of hit testing the interactive objects and passes the hit across in the function.
